hits.author: l72
hits.comment_text:
I have enabled web push notifications for a few sites, specifically Slack and Help Lightning. But those are both communication tools where I often use a browser instead of a native app and want immediate message notifications.

I have never, nor would I ever enable web push notifications for any sort of marketing or newsletters. I am still a huge RSS reader fan, and use imapfilter to automatically format and send certain emails directly to my RSS service (freshrss) [1].

I am big on zero-inbox, so I _hate_ having non important stuff in there. But for some reason, having a backlog of RSS feeds doesn't bother me! I wonder if part of it is that I find mobile email clients and web email clients so limiting when it comes to filtering and managing messages/threads.

[1] https://blog.line72.net/2021/12/23/converting-bandcamp-email...
hits.story_title: Ask HN: Do newsletters work? Why do websites push them so much?

comment_text.value:
I have enabled web push notifications for a few sites, specifically Slack and Help Lightning. But those are both communication tools where I often use a browser instead of a native app and want immediate message notifications.

I have never, nor would I ever enable web push notifications for any sort of marketing or newsletters. I am still a huge RSS reader fan, and use imapfilter to automatically format and send certain emails directly to my RSS service (freshrss) [1].

I am big on zero-inbox, so I _hate_ having non important stuff in there. But for some reason, having a backlog of RSS feeds doesn't bother me! I wonder if part of it is that I find mobile email clients and web email clients so limiting when it comes to filtering and managing messages/threads.

[1] https://blog.line72.net/2021/12/23/converting-bandcamp-email...

PicassoMD | Senior Engineer | Washington, DC or REMOTE | https://picasso.md

PicassoMD is working to improve our healthcare system by connecting primary care providers with specialists to better collaborate on patient care. Through our mobile apps, PicassoMD facilitates more appropriate triaging of patients, seamless transition of care, and ongoing coordination. The result is a reduction in unnecessary referrals and ER visits and better patient experience and outcomes.

We're looking for a Senior Engineer to work on our React Native and Ruby on Rails codebases: https://apply.workable.com/picassomd/j/52AF49E55C/

hits.author: PolkadotHiring
hits.comment_text:
Polka Dot Sky Software (Multiple Roles) | Remote | Contract or Full-time/part-time with flexible schedules) | https://polkadotskysoftware.com/ Do you want the chance to do meaningful work, on a remote, flexible schedule, with a positive, supportive work environment?

Polka Dot Sky Software strives to create impactful digital infrastructure that empowers citizens and eases business operations. We're looking for dependable and flexible candidates who come to every situation with a calm and constructive attitude. We wish to maintain a friendly, encouraging work space- we love our job, and we know you will too!

These positions are fully remote (US only) with core hours between 1 PM and 5 PM EST. Authorization to work in the United States is required.

We are looking for multiple roles at the moment: Full-Stack or Elixir Developer To qualify you must have proven full-stack development experience with Elixir/Phoenix (or similar frameworks), and have taken software features from idea to design, development, and released it to users. We work with Phoenix, (LiveView, Exq/Oban) and Postgres, use DataDog for monitoring, and host on AWS. Bonus if you have understanding of Ember.js, React and/or React Native, and HashiCorp products (Terraform, Nomad, Vault). Applicants for this position must be based in the USA.

Mobile Developer We manage four apps in a monorepo using React Native. We'd like to upgrade the codebase, put in react-query, and start using graphql. If this is something you can help us with (and set us up for the next wave of customers), you might enjoy this role.

DevOps Engineer (Terraform a bonus) We are embarking on a pretty big project that would involve potentially moving up to 80 websites over to a modern, containerized architecture using Terraform (on AWS). If this seems appealing, get in touch! Compensation is negotiable based on skill set.

Please send your resume to people@polkadotskysoftware.com for further information please visit us at https://polkadotskysoftware.com/join-us/

hits.author: j_kao
hits.comment_text:
Radar Labs | Software Engineers & Technical PMs (infra, platform, data, full-stack, mobile) | Remote US / New York City | Full Time

https://radar.com Radar Labs is a location infrastructure SaaS platform.

We've recently raised our Series C and are a small, but mighty engineering team (9 engineers!). We're based across the US, with an HQ in NYC in Union Square.

There's a ton of opportunity to make an impact and work on a variety of things, as we're a pretty fluid team:

- Infrastructure (e.g. Evaluate our production workloads on ARM64 and build out our AWS stack with Terraform CDK)

- Platform (e.g. Build out abstractions for our product engineers to ingest and compute geo queries at high-scale)

- Data (e.g. Process, deduplicate, and evaluate 10s of millions of POIs from a variety of vendors and open data)

- Mobile (e.g. building a control system that automatically configures optimizing battery-life and location accuracy for different use-cases over time)

- Product (e.g. build tools to visualize and debug location data at scale)

We power location experiences for over 100M devices, serving over 10k QPS of geo queries. The numbers are growing day-by-day!

Check out our jobs page here: https://radar.com/jobs

If you have any questions, feel free to reply here or you can e-mail me at jeff@

onX Maps | Site Reliability Engineer | Montana or REMOTE (US only)| https://onxmaps.hrmdirect.com/employment/job-opening.php?req...

ABOUT – Are you an Engineer who loves the outdoors? Join onX! onX is a suite of digital navigation apps (Hunt, Offroad, and Backcountry) that empower millions of outdoor enthusiasts. If you’re passionate about writing great software, love playing outside, believe in protecting access to public lands, and want to dominate the off-pavement mobile GPS market – then join our team, where we empower millions of outdoor enthusiasts to explore the unknown!

We have multiple Engineering openings! View them here: https://www.onxmaps.com/join-our-team

Here are some of the technologies we work with:

Site Reliability (Terraform, Kubernetes, GCP)

3D (OpenGL, Metal, C++)

Data Automation (Python, PostgreSQL, GIS)

Android (Kotlin)

iOS (Swift)

Backend (Go, Elixir, GraphQL, GCP, Kubernetes)

Web (Vue JS)

ioki | Frankfurt (Remote in Germany) | Full-Time | Various Positions | New Mobility / Public Transport ioki.com a Startup based in Frankfurt that is a full subsidiary of the Deutsche Bahn.

ioki is a Startup based in Germany that works on the future of mobility.

With modern technology and practices we try to shape the public transport of tomorrow.

We are building smart mobility solutions to integrate with the public transport systems for driver-based AND driverless vehicles.

We already operate more than 40! of these services in Germany and Europe.

Check out https://jobs.ioki.com for our recently opened positions:

Golang engineers for autonomous driving projects ● Ruby/Rails for real time fleet dispatching ● React(Native) for turn-by-turn navigation ● TypeScript (Frontend/Backend) for mobility analytics and visualization ● Site Reliablity Engineering for keeping it all together :D

Happy to answer any questions, please reach out to christian.baeuerlein[at]ioki.com

hits.author: mtlmtlmtlmtl
hits.comment_text:
And FDR had polio. JFK had Addison's disease and required regular treatment. Alan Turing revolutionised pretty much all of science and then committed suicide. Clearly someone can be pretty much maximally successful in their endeavours, and yet still have diseases that have a significant negative impact on their life, whether it's their sense of happiness, problems with interpersonal relations, or mobility.

As for doubting Elon Musk's claims: I generally don't raise doubts about someone claiming a diagnosis. I know from personal experience how shitty it feels to have the veracity of your suffering questioned like that. And in Musk's case, I have no issue believing he has some interpersonal issues, and asperger's(autism spectrum disorder in DSM-V) could explain that, so I don't see any reason to doubt him in this case.
hits.story_title: TikTok videos leave teens thinking they have rare mental disorders (2021)

comment_text.value:
And FDR had polio. JFK had Addison's disease and required regular treatment. Alan Turing revolutionised pretty much all of science and then committed suicide. Clearly someone can be pretty much maximally successful in their endeavours, and yet still have diseases that have a significant negative impact on their life, whether it's their sense of happiness, problems with interpersonal relations, or mobility.

As for doubting Elon Musk's claims: I generally don't raise doubts about someone claiming a diagnosis. I know from personal experience how shitty it feels to have the veracity of your suffering questioned like that. And in Musk's case, I have no issue believing he has some interpersonal issues, and asperger's(autism spectrum disorder in DSM-V) could explain that, so I don't see any reason to doubt him in this case.

story_title.value: TikTok videos leave teens thinking they have rare mental disorders (2021)

hits.author: cmason
hits.comment_text:
Navio | React Native | REMOTE-first | In-Office Portland or Austin or Bay Area also possible | Full Time

Navio is a startup building software tools that help cancer patients and their doctors navigate to a better standard of care. We make web and mobile applications that patients use to understand and track their treatment plan, to stay on schedule and on their meds, and to complete clinical trials. Ultimately, we aim to gather knowledge about what works that can improve care for everyone.

Navio is hiring for:

* React / React Native

Navio is looking for a React developer that loves complex, strongly typed applications with lots of moving parts. We build with Typescript and GraphQL in an event-driven architecture. Experience with React Native and app-store submission is a plus as we plan to launch a native mobile app soon. Underneath, Navio’s app is a data-driven, no-code tool for constructing tailored patient experiences. We have a couple great UX designers and make beautiful things that patients love.

Are you ready to build something that truly benefits people? Come do meaningful work in a fun, fast-paced environment. We offer competitive benefits and stock options. careers at navio.com

Tesseract Health | iOS/Swift Mobile Software Engineer | Full-Time/Permanent | Remote (US only) with occasional travel | https://www.tesseracthealth.com/ |

Tesseract Health is a well-funded start-up organization under the 4Catalyzer family of successful health-tech start-ups (https://www.4catalyzer.com/). Our work is focused around reinventing medical devices to leverage the health information in the human eye and championing a new era of healthcare by creating portable, affordable, easy to use, connected devices for early disease detection and monitoring.

We are looking for an iOS/Swift Mobile Software Engineer to lead the development of our iPad app. Ideal candidates will have 3+ years experience in building mobile applications on iOS, in-depth understanding of Swift and iOS SDK and experience with backend server APIs. You can view the full job description here: https://boards.greenhouse.io/tesseract/jobs/5142671003

We offer competitive salaried compensation, equity, bonus program, fully covered medical, dental & vision insurance plan, 401(k) plan, flexible work arrangements and unlimited PTO, education reimbursement program, team member "treat yourself" allowance and much more! Plus, an opportunity to build a revolutionary healthcare product!

Email your resume and contact information to klebreux@tesseracthealth.com to apply or ask any questions!

hits.author: dredmorbius
hits.comment_text:
I was thinking among options:

- Library is a Group Administrator for patrons' Google accounts.

- Library offers its own email services to patrons.

- Library holds recovery codes (perferably under some sort of escrow).

All of these put burden on the library, of course. Though there's already a substantial burden.

There's also the issue of itenerant / mobile patrons who may only be using a library on a temporary basis or operate between several locations. How much this is a use pattern I've no idea.

The USPS offering email services might be yet another option. Points of presence in every ZIP code, often several.

Given other ongoing challenges (housing is now a full-blown crisis), the problem of mobile / indigent / precarious indivudal will only grow.

The pattern is also likely to be repeated in other global regions.

comment_text.value:
I was thinking among options:

- Library is a Group Administrator for patrons' Google accounts.

- Library offers its own email services to patrons.

- Library holds recovery codes (perferably under some sort of escrow).

All of these put burden on the library, of course. Though there's already a substantial burden.

There's also the issue of itenerant / mobile patrons who may only be using a library on a temporary basis or operate between several locations. How much this is a use pattern I've no idea.

The USPS offering email services might be yet another option. Points of presence in every ZIP code, often several.

Given other ongoing challenges (housing is now a full-blown crisis), the problem of mobile / indigent / precarious indivudal will only grow.

The pattern is also likely to be repeated in other global regions.

hits.author: eiq-eiq-eiq
hits.comment_text:
NextEra Mobility | Software Engineers, Engineering Manager, Q/A Lead, UX Designer | REMOTE or San Francisco | Full Time

Annual emissions from U.S. fleet-operated fossil-fuel cars and trucks:

* contribute ~1Gt CO2e, or 2% of the world's total GHG emissions [1]

* kill ~10,000 people [2]

We can save lives and abate climate change by replacing these vehicles with clean equivalents. Our team writes software that plays a key role in deploying clean vehicles and new renewable electricity generation at large scale. [3] We need:

* Software engineers: https://jobs.nexteraenergy.com/job/San-Francisco-Senior-Soft...

* A front-end developer who can improve our UI test automation: https://jobs.nexteraenergy.com/job/San-Francisco-QA-Automati...

* Engineering Managers: https://jobs.nexteraenergy.com/job/San-Francisco-New-Product...

Join us! I'm the hiring manager; you can reach me directly at samuel.penrose at nexteraenergy.com We are remote-first with a great San Francisco office where we gather quarterly (-> occasional travel required).

[1] https://www.epa.gov/greenvehicles/fast-facts-transportation-...

[2] https://pubs.acs.org/doi/10.1021/acs.estlett.0c00424

[3] https://pv-magazine-usa.com/2022/01/31/daimler-nextera-and-b...

hits.author: deleted_account
hits.comment_text:
The "player" spending this money is the content creator Jtisallbusiness. Self professed as "THE NUMBER ONE YOUTUBER FOR CASTLE CLASH & OTHER MOBILE GAMING CONTENT!", this looks like a business pouring expense money into a micro-transaction game and drumming up PR.

It would be more disturbing if players at this end of the spending curve _didn't_ encounter game-breaking issues. I'd be more alarmed if the headline read: "After $100K, YouTuber professes, 'This is where the game gets fun.'"
hits.story_title: Diablo Immortal player spends $100k, cant find anyone suitable to matchmake with

hits.author: bd723
hits.comment_text:
Motive | Backend Engineers, Fintech Engineers, Mobile (IOS) Engineers, Site Reliability Engineers, Dev Ops | Remote |

Motive builds technology to improve the safety, productivity, and profitability of businesses that power the physical economy. The Motive Automated Operations Platform combines IoT hardware with AI-powered applications to automate vehicle and equipment tracking, driver safety, compliance, maintenance, spend management, and more. Motive serves more than 120,000 businesses, across a wide range of industries including trucking and logistics, construction, oil and gas, food and beverage, field service, agriculture, passenger transit, and delivery.

Motive is proud to be a Forbes Cloud 100 company and a 2020 Career-Launching Company by Wealthfront.

We are looking to hire engineers around the globe that are passionate about building products that will have a massive impact on the lives of people. We seek and embrace diversity in all of its forms. We continuously push ourselves to think differently and take ownership wherever it's needed. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed. If you share our passion for achieving what some say is impossible, join us.

https://gomotive.com/company/careers/#search-jobs

Visa Sponsorship: We can transfer H1b visas, we are also hiring in Bangalore, Canada, Taiwan, and Pakistan

Sample Tech Stack: Golang, Ruby, Java, AWS, PostgreSql, DynamoDB, Redis, Cassandra, Kafka, etc.

Contact: becky.diaz@gomotive.com

hits.author: HoyaSaxa
hits.comment_text:
Narmi (Techstars NYC '17)| New York, NY (NYC) | ONSITE (really a lax hybrid) | https://www.narmi.com

Narmi is helping reinvent banking in the United States. We create a more accessible and useful financial ecosystem by powering the online banking, mobile banking, account opening and open banking APIs for the 10,000 credit unions and community banks in the United States.

You'll be working on production software that has a real impact on the average American's life everyday. Our software helps them save money on their bills, understand their financial story, protect their families and move money.

Narmi was founded by two Georgetown University alums who previously worked as CEO and CTO of an $18 million credit union and also at some of the largest banks in the world.

Plus we are backed by a top 5 VC (NEA), growing very quickly, and operating close to cash flow neutral.

Even if you don't think you are an exact fit for one of our current openings, we'd still love to talk. We are always looking for well-rounded engineers to join our team in NYC.

- Senior Full Stack Engineer https://jobs.lever.co/narmi/c4010f88-21b9-4d89-9d67-510b6cd9...

- Software Engineer - Quality https://jobs.lever.co/narmi/7d30242d-febc-4aac-97e9-e8b60c5b...

- Senior Software Engineer - Infrastructure & Reliability https://jobs.lever.co/narmi/c807303d-7fb8-4a98-8c9b-99ae2d7b...

The interview process entails an intro call to get to know each other, a remote pair coding session (for technical positions), and a remote "onsite" half-day.

Some keywords: * Senior Full Stack Engineer, Senior Full-stack Engineer, Senior Full Stack Developer, Senior Full-stack Developer * Senior Front End Engineer, Senior Front-end Engineer, Senior Front End Developer, Senior Software Engineer, Senior Product Engineer, Software Engineer * SRE, Devops * Banking, finance, online banking, mobile banking, open banking APIs, * New York City, New York, NY, NYC, Manhattan

You can learn more on our website (https://www.narmi.com/careers). Make sure to mention you found us on Hacker News. Also please feel free to reach out directly to me chris @ our domain.

hits.author: texodus
hits.comment_text:
Prospective Co. | Engineering & Product | REMOTE (US Only)

We're looking for senior product managers and engineers of all experience levels to build the next generation of collaborative data visualization. At the Prospective Co., you'll contribute to our existing open-source project as well as help design our enterprise offering.

https://perspective.finos.org/

We're looking for any of:

- Familiarity with WebAssembly, data visualization, WebGL/OpenGL, data science, Jupyter/notebook, web/desktop/mobile UI development, compiler/language or database design, finance services.

- Primary stack is Rust (targeting WebAssembly). JavaScript, C++ and Python are a big plus.

- We <3 GitHub contributors - opt to discuss your GitHub work in lieu of a technical interview.

Contact andrew@prospective.dev
